method.name: GET
method.doc: With the Article Search API, you can search New York Times articles from 1981 to today, retrieving headlines, abstracts, lead paragraphs, links to associated multimedia and other article metadata. Along with standard keyword searching, the API also offers faceted searching. The available facets include Times-specific fields such as sections, taxonomic classifiers and controlled vocabulary terms (names of people, organizations and geographic locations).

param.name: query
param.doc: Search keywords (optionally applied to specific fields) and/or facets. Keywords can be specified with or without a limiting "field:" label. Facets must be specified in the format "facet-field:[facet-value]". See "Constructing a Search Query" in the API docs for more information and examples.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Article Search API.

param.name: begin_date
param.doc: Sets the starting point (inclusive) of the range of publication dates to return. Must be used with end_date. Format: YYYYMMDD

param.name: end_date
param.doc: Sets the end point (inclusive) of the range of publication dates to return. Must be used with begin_date. Format: YYYYMMDD

param.name: facets
param.doc: Comma-delimited list of up to 5 facets. Specifies the sets of facet values to include in the facets array at the beginning of response, which collects the facet values from all the search results. See API docs for more info.

param.name: fields
param.doc: Comma-delimited list of fields (no limit). Specifies the fields (including facets) you want return for each search result. By default (unless you include a fields list in your request), the following fields are returned for each result: body, byline, date, title, url. To return only the array of facet values (no search results), set fields to a blank space (encoded: fields=+) and include the facets parameter. See API docs for more info.

param.name: format
param.doc: Response format. Currently, only JSON is supported. Default: json

param.name: offset
param.doc: The value of offset corresponds to a set of 10 results (it does not indicate the starting number of the result set). For example, offset=0 corresponds to records 0-9. To return records 10-19, set offset to 1, not 10. Range: 0 to last set of ten. Default: 0

param.name: rank
param.doc: Use the rank parameter to set the order of the results. Accepted values: newest (default), oldest, closest

param.name: version
param.doc: The API version. The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a Times best-seller list.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Best Sellers API.

param.name: date
param.doc: The best-seller list publication date. You do not have to specify the exact date the list was published. The service will search forward (into the future) for the closest publication date to the date you specify. For example, a request for "lists/2008-10-01/hardcover-nonfiction.xml" will retrieve the list that was published on 10-05. If you do not include a date, the current list-name will be returned. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

param.name: list-name
param.doc: The Times best-seller list to retrieve. To get all valid best-seller list names, use the Best-Seller List Names request type. Be sure to replace spaces with hyphens (e.g., e-book-fiction or hardcover-fiction, not E-Book Fiction or Hardcover Fiction). (The parameter is not case sensitive.) Note: This parameter can be passed as list-name or list. Format: string, hyphenated

param.name: offset
param.doc: Sets the starting point of the result set. The first 20 results are shown by default. To page through the results, set offset to the appropriate value (e.g., offset=20 displays results 21â€“40). Accepted values: positive integer, multiple of 20

param.name: sort-by
param.doc: For details on the available sort options, see API docs. If you do not specify a sort-by value, the results will be sorted by best-seller rank. Accepted values: bestsellers-date, date, isbn, list, list-name, published-date, rank, rank-last-week, weeks-on-list

param.name: sort-order
param.doc: Sets the sort order of the result set. The default is ASC (ascending). The sort-order parameter is used with the sort-by parameter â€” for details, see each request type. Accepted values: ASC (ascending), DESC (descending)

param.name: version
param.doc: The API version. The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

Candidate name format: {last-name}[,first-name] (first-name is optional) If you include a first name, there should be no space after the comma. If you do not include a first-name, data will be returned for all candidates with the last-name you specify. Committee ID format: C + 9 digits. The FEC assigns a unique ID to each campaign committee. param.name: sort

param.doc: The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: match-type
param.doc: Sets the search type: get only the URL you specify, or search for similar URLs. If you specify exact-match, the first 25 comments associated with that URL will be returned if the URL is found. If there is no exact match, an empty result set will be returned. If you specify closest-stem-match, the most similar URLs will be returned. (No comments will be returned.) Accepted values: exact-match, closest-stem-match

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.doc: Retrieves a list of members of a particular chamber in a particular Congress.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Congress API.

param.name: state
param.doc: Limits the list of members by state. Format: Two-letter state code (e.g., CA)

param.name: district
param.doc: Limits the list of members by district (House only). If you specify a district, you must also specify a state. If the district number you specify is higher than the total number of districts for that state, a 404 response will be returned. Note: Member list responses include district numbers. Format: House of Representatives district number

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v3. Version 2 is no longer supported. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: member-id
param.doc: The member's unique ID number. To find a member's ID number, get the list of members for the appropriate House or Senate. You can also use the Biographical Directory of the United States Congress to get a member's ID. In search results, each member's name is linked to a record by index ID (e.g., http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=C001041). Use the index ID as member-id in your request. Format: alphanumeric

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return JSON, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. XML is the default format; you do not need to add the .xml extension to get an XML response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns New York City political districts.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for District API.

param.name: lat
param.doc: Limits the response to political districts that contain the specified point. Specify a latitude and longitude to retrieve districts (at all levels) for a particular location in NYC. If you include one of these parameters, you must include the other; you cannot specify only latitude or only longitude. If you do not specify a lat and lng, a complete list of New York City districts will be returned.

param.name: lng
param.doc: Limits the response to political districts that contain the specified point. Specify a latitude and longitude to retrieve districts (at all levels) for a particular location in NYC. If you include one of these parameters, you must include the other; you cannot specify only latitude or only longitude. If you do not specify a lat and lng, a complete list of New York City districts will be returned.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: resource-type
param.doc: Accepted values: mostemailed, mostshared, mostviewed. The mostemailed and mostviewed resource types correspond to the Most Popular module on the NYTimes.com home page.

param.name: section
param.doc: Limits the results by one or more sections. Accepted values: all-sections | One or more section names, separated by semicolons. To get all sections, specify all-sections. To get a particular section or sections, use the section names returned by this request (specifying the appropriate resource type)

param.name: share-types
param.doc: Limits the results by the method used to share the items (mostshared requests only). Accepted values: One or more types, separated by semicolons: digg, email, facebook, mixx, myspace, permalink, timespeople, twitter, yahoobuzz. If you do not specify any share-types, all share types will be included. Optional.

param.name: time-period
param.doc: Accepted values: 1, 7, 30 Corresponds to a day, a week, or a month of content.

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns movie reviews by keyword.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Movie Reviews API.

param.name: query
param.doc: Search keywords; matches movie title and indexed terms. See API docs for more details.

param.name: critics-pick
param.doc: Limits by NYT Critics' Picks status. Set this parameter to Y to limt the results to NYT Critics' Picks. To get only those movies that have not been highlighted by Times critics, specify critics-pick=N. (To get all reviews regardless of critics-pick status, simply omit this parameter.) Accepted values: Y, N

param.name: thousand-best
param.doc: Limits by Best 1,000 Movies status. Set this parameter to Y to limit the results to movies on the Times list of The Best 1,000 Movies Ever Made. To get only those movies that are not on the list, specify thousand-best=N. (To get all reviews regardless of thousand-best status, simply omit this parameter.) Accepted values: Y, N

param.name: dvds
param.doc: Limits by format. Set this parameter to Y to limit the results to movies that have been released on DVD. To get only those movies that have not been released on DVD, specify dvd=N. (To get all reviews regardless of format, simply omit this parameter.) Accepted values: Y, N

param.name: reviewer
param.doc: Limits by a specific NYT critic. Include this parameter to limit your results to reviews by a specific critic. Reviewer names should be hyphenated or concatenated with dots (e.g., manohla-dargis or manohla.dargis).

param.name: publication-date
param.doc: Limits by date or range of dates. The publication-date is the date the review was first published in The Times. Format: Single date: YYYY-MM-DD, or Start and end date: YYYY-MM-DD;YYYY-MM-DD

param.name: opening-date
param.doc: Limits by date or range of dates. The publication-date is the movie's opening date in the New York region. Format: Single date: YYYY-MM-DD, or Start and end date: YYYY-MM-DD;YYYY-MM-DD

param.name: opening-date
param.doc: Limits by date or range of dates. The publication-date is the movie's opening date in the New York region. Format: Single date: YYYY-MM-DD, or Start and end date: YYYY-MM-DD;YYYY-MM-DD

param.name: offset
param.doc: Sets the starting point of the result set. The first 20 results are shown by default. To page through the results, set offset to the appropriate value (e.g., offset=20 displays results 21â€“40). Format: Positive integer, multiple of 20

param.name: order
param.doc: Sets the sort order of the results. Accepted values: by-title, by-publication-date, by-opening-date, by-dvd-release-date. See API docs for more details.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.) Note: The recent updates are point releases â€” continue to specify v2 in your requests.

param.name: resource-type
param.doc: All reviews or NYT Critics' Picks. Accepted values: all, picks, dvd-picks. Specify all to retrieve all reviews, including NYT Critics' Picks, and covering movies currently in theaters as well as movies on DVD. Specify picks to get NYT Critics' Picks currently in theaters. Specify dvd-picks to get NYT Critics' Picks on DVD.

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns listings percentiles (for example, the 50th percentile price for condo listings in Manhattan in July 2007)

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Real Estate API.

param.name: bedrooms
param.doc: Limits the results by number of bedrooms. Default: 1 or more

param.name: building-type-id
param.doc: Limits the results to a type of building (e.g., condo). To get a list of a valid building-type-id values, issue a building-types request. Note: Use type 2 ("Rental") for apartments.

param.name: date-range
param.doc: Sets the quarter, month, week or day for the results. Format: quarter: YYYY-Qq, month: YYYY-MM, week: YYYY-Www, day: YYYY-MM-DD. Quarters and weeks are specified by number (e.g., 2008-Q1, 2008-W52) in ISO 8601 format. For listings requests, listings that were active (on the market) during the specified date range are returned. For sales requests, recorded sales within the specified date range are returned.

param.name: geo-extent-level
param.doc: Sets the geographic unit for the results. This parameter sets the unit (not the value) for the geographic extent of the results. Specify the value (the actual borough, neighborhood or ZIP code) with the geo-extent-value parameter. Accepted values: borough, neighborhood, zip

param.name: geo-extent-value
param.doc: Limits the results to a particular area (New York City only). Use geo-extent-level to specify a geographic unit, and then specify a borough, neighborhood or ZIP code with geo-extent-value. To get a list of a valid neighborhood values, use the neighborhoods method.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: response-format
param.doc: To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

param.name: building-type-id
param.doc: Limits the results to a type of building (e.g., condo). To get a list of a valid building-type-id values, issue a building-types request. Note: Use type 2 ("Rental") for apartments.

param.doc: Sets the geographic unit for the results. This parameter sets the unit (not the value) for the geographic extent of the results. Specify the value (the actual borough, neighborhood or ZIP code) with the geo-extent-value parameter. Accepted values: borough, neighborhood, zip

param.name: geo-extent-value
param.doc: Limits the results to a particular area (New York City only). Use geo-extent-level to specify a geographic unit, and then specify a borough, neighborhood or ZIP code with geo-extent-value. To get a list of a valid neighborhood values, use the neighborhoods method.

param.name: geo-summary-level
param.doc: Sets the geographic unit for grouping the results. Within the extent you specify (with geo-extent-level and geo-extent-value), results are grouped by the geo-summary-level value. Accepted values: borough, neighborhood, zip.

param.name: response-format
param.doc: To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns valid building-type-id values.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Real Estate API.

param.name: response-format
param.doc: To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns valid neighborhood values.

param.name: borough
param.doc: Optional limit by NYC borough. Accepted values: Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, Staten Island

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Real Estate API.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v3. Version 2 will be supported until August 2010. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: source
param.doc: Limits the set of items by originating source. Accepted values: all, nyt, iht. all = items from both The New York Times and The International Herald Tribune. nyt = New York Times items only. iht = International Herald Tribune items only.

param.name: section
param.doc: Limits the set of items by one or more sections. Accepted values: all, [One or more section names, separated by semicolons]. To get all sections, specify all. To get a particular section or sections, use the section names returned by the section-list method

param.name: time-period
param.doc: Limits the set of items by time published. If you do not specify a time-period, all available recent items will be returned. Format: Integer, number of hours, 1â€“720 (up to one month). Optional.

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns recent news items.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Times Newswire API.

param.name: limit
param.doc: Limits the number of results. Format: Integer, 1â€“20. Default: 20

param.name: offset
param.doc: Sets the starting point of the result set. Format: Integer, 0-[number of available records]. Default: 0 (first record)

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v3. Version 2 will be supported until August 2010. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a specific news item. The response will be a standard Newswire response, but for that item only. Note: The Newswire cache is cleared regularly, so only recent news items can be retrieved with this request type. Use the Article Search API to get older items.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Times Newswire API.

param.name: url
param.doc: The complete URL of a specific news item, URL-encoded or backslash-escaped.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v3. Version 2 will be supported until August 2010. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns list of valid section names.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Times Newswire API.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v1.

param.name: user-id
param.doc: A TimesPeople user ID number. To get a user's ID number, issue a user ID request, as described below. You can also get a userâ€™s ID number from a TimesPeople profile page. The ID number appears in the URL for the page. Example: http://timespeople.nytimes.com/view/user/9999999/activities.html (ID = 9999999)

param.name: data-type
param.doc: Accepted values: profile, activities, newsfeed, followers, following. See API docs for more info.

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. Add the appropriate extension to your request. There is no default format â€” your request must include an extension. Accepted values: js (JSON), xml (XML)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a user's profile, activity, news feed or followers/following lists.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Times People API.

param.name: version
param.doc: The current version is v1.

param.name: hash
param.doc: The MD5 hash of the user's e-mail address. Note: The e-mail address used to generate the MD5 hash value must be all lowercase (for example, myname@myemail.com, not MyName@MyEmail.com). Format: 32-digit hex number

param.name: response-format
param.doc: Sets the representation data format. Add the appropriate extension to your request. There is no default format â€” your request must include an extension. Accepted values: js (JSON), xml (XML)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the user ID of a TimesPeople user given a hash of their email address.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Times People API.

method.name: GET
method.doc: With the TimesTags API, you can mine the riches of the New York Times tag set. The TimesTags service matches your query to the controlled vocabularies that fuel NYTimes.com metadata. You supply a string of characters, and the service returns a ranked list of suggested terms.

param.name: api-key
param.doc: API Key for Times People API.

param.name: query
param.doc: Your search query. If you do not specify a value for "filter", your query will be matched to tags in all four Times dictionaries: subject, geographic location, organization and person. See API docs for more info.

param.name: filter
param.doc: Limits the results to the specified Times dictionaries. See API docs for more info. Format: Comma-delimited list (case-sensitive)

param.name: max
param.doc: Sets the maximum number of results. If you do not specify a value for max, 10 results will be returned.
